website_summaries.verdict: One of the best premium surfboard roof carriers designed to protect the roof and board from damage during transport.
pros: The large pad is capable of carrying multiple thin surfboards at the same time using the included straps
Larger straps are secured right to the carrier for quick installation
cons: Rack requires separate roof rack bars to be installed correctly

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2014 subaru wrx with oem crossbars with the inno wind fairing and it fits great not a lot of noise on the highway wich I was concerned about with or without boards ,I just leave it on looks kinds bad ass xD I live in az and do weekend trips to CA so ppl ask all the time what do those racks carry lol but I would highly recommend these to anyone not wanting their boards jacked it's by no means thief proof but it would take a lot of motivation to break into these.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Very well designed and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: These racks have been awesome so far. I’ve had multiple long boards and short boards on them and they are easy to strap on and remove. When I need to take the racks off it takes less then 5 minutes. The first time I put them on it took about 10-20 minutes to get everything figured out but after that it’s been dead simple. If you want to spend a fraction of your time strapping and in strapping boards to your vehicle, buy these racks.
customer_reviews.author: RbeMac

customer_reviews.title: Survived a cross country trip with no issue
customer_reviews.text: I drove cross country from NY to LA in 6 days with this on my roof carrying a surfboard. Absolutely no problems the entire 2000ish mile drive. Holds boards in sturdy and very easy to take off and put on.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Ely

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, works great!
customer_reviews.text: Install was a breeze (even on our Rhino Rack with the thin, square "Euro" bars). Our daughter has been using her new surf rack for a few weeks now, without issues. Makes transporting surfboards easy, as opposed using straps/tie-downs, especially for a shorter person. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Petrik

customer_reviews.title: Paddle boards roof rack
customer_reviews.text: I thought is was going to be hard to put on but it was very easy to install. Unfortunately the rack was too small for my boards. So I had to return it. So sad.
customer_reviews.author: Xxx

customer_reviews.title: Works and Easy to install - 2003 Subaru Baja
customer_reviews.text: I love these racks. Easy to get the boards on and off. They were very easy to install and keep my surfboards safe and sound. I've had it almost two years and haven't had any problems yet. Someone mentioned the lock wasn't that great. Maybe not, but it's safer than no lock. Just like anything, if someone wants your stuff they will find a way to get it - the lock won't keep out someone that really wants your boards, but I've never had a problem. Goodbye straps! Only for surfboards, not for paddle boards.
customer_reviews.author: The Bearded Hiker

customer_reviews.title: The best locking surf rack
customer_reviews.text: This rack system is great for transporting your board(s), plus some added security with the locking feature. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Adam S. Ertel

customer_reviews.title: to fit round bars needs adapter
customer_reviews.text: Just got the INNo INA744 board locker. Looks well built I will update my review after i have used it. Wanted to let buyers know that to fit round bars you need to purchase adapter ISF715 sold separately. This is not clear in the description, and conveniently amazon doesn't carry it. also the nuts in the universal mounts are a nylon, I have had the Thule ones break on me, but not big deal can be replaced easily and cheaply. the inside width is 24 inches so if you are carring a large SUP board it might not fit you would need a pad or get the canoe Kayak carrier.
customer_reviews.author: K. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Needs crossbars!
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a sturdy product and arrived in good time but i didn’t get to use it because it was not clearly advertised that you need to have crossbars for this to latch onto your car. Don’t buy unless you have a car equipped with crossbars! Not worth it to me to buy crossbars for another $200
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Z

customer_reviews.title: Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Made several trips from VA to FL with long and short boards. No problems at all. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent at first blush....
customer_reviews.text: Have used this on two surf adventures and so far so good. One concern I have is whether the cables could stand up to bolt cutters (probably not) but the supreme ease of loading up my 10 foot Hap Jacobs board makes them worth while! Will update this review as I gain more experience but seems to be a very well constructed product deserving of it's Amazon accolades. THANKS!
customer_reviews.author: Chris S. King

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: This rack flew off my car and almost hit another. I would like my money back even though I missed the window for return
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Log blasters
customer_reviews.text: Epic rack system, easy to load the log and once your at the beach you can flip the switch and blast out to the line up. Worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Best surf racks out there
customer_reviews.text: Best surf racks out there. We did a lot of research and these are perfect! Easy to install an remove. Easy to load boards. Keeps the boards secure while driving and locked tight on the roof when going in a shop or something. PERFECT!
customer_reviews.author: C. Cole

customer_reviews.title: kind of cheap
customer_reviews.text: The racks were not padded as much as I thought. The lock is pretty cheap. The bolts are barely long enough. Come on, I have a ford explorer, one of the most common suvs out there.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Maldeis

customer_reviews.title: This is a great rack. Easy to set up and easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rack. Easy to set up and easy to use. Boards go on and off quickly. I wish I had bought it a few years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Leo K

customer_reviews.title: It works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: It is amazing. But it should have more assembly options.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase! Absolutely worth every penny. I have researched this product for awhile and decided to purchase when I found it for a great price on Amazon. Once you have it set up on your rack system, it literally takes two minutes to strap your boards down. And it locks so no need to worry about someone walking off with your boards when you stop for a bite to eat and brew after a long day on the water!
customer_reviews.author: Shanna

customer_reviews.title: Baja surf trip
customer_reviews.text: These are great surfboard racks. Just did a three week trip to southern baja carried four boards no problem. Love locking feature. Keeps boards very secure and simple to take off and on. Did a lot of off-road driving.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 2007 Subaru Impreza Factory Crossbars
customer_reviews.text: The item looks very well put together and would have been able to meet my needs. However, as the it states on the website "Fits MOST factory crossbars" which did not include the 2007 Subaru Impreza Factory Crossbars as they were not "long" enough cross-wise and the mounts are not adjustable. By all means, this looks like a great product. Just double check before buying!
customer_reviews.author: Cool Dude Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This works great and I love the added security of the lock! Very good quality and I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley P.

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: great product with a wonderful price! easy to install and to use with my surf board! works fine with any type of car.
customer_reviews.author: Rebeca Rehder

customer_reviews.title: Great racks!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these racks for years and they have not given me a bit of trouble. Knowing that my boards are secure lets me enjoy my meal at a restaurant and not worry because I could not find a parking place, where I could see my boards.
customer_reviews.author: seadancer

customer_reviews.title: Great rack
customer_reviews.text: Best rack for the price, don't hesitate to buy it. look for the longbolt kit if you have over sized bars
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It is quick and secure. I used to use the Thule carrier, but I would have to adjust it for my different board widths and then the strap would also make noise. This rack if great and fit my square Thule bars beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Inno surfboard rack
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product. It sure beats using straps! I would recomend it to anyone that is looking for a reliable rack for their surfboards.
customer_reviews.author: Brian T Wisnieski

customer_reviews.title: Awkward to work with
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like the way it fit, it was awkward to put on and off boards. I found another product that was better, the Thule double decker that also locks.
customer_reviews.author: DY

customer_reviews.title: bmatulnes
customer_reviews.text: These locking racks are amazing! I bought these for my Expedition for my surf boards, and they are easy to install as well as use. The cranking system on the board is very useful and does not harm the surf board at all. Driving down the road with my surf board attached to these on my vehicle makes me feel safer than other racking systems. I would recommend this highly for all surfers!
customer_reviews.author: bmatulnes

customer_reviews.title: This is the best surf rack you can get
customer_reviews.text: Hands down - the best. Speed? This rack has got it. The "crane" system lifts up the straps, so no more running around to the other side of your car to loop your straps around the bars. Seriously. Surfers. Think about that for a minute. This rack gets you more water time! It must have been designed by someone who KNOWS. The only downside is that if your roof isn't too wide, you won't be able to do boards side-by-side and pile on 4+ boards. I've put 3 longboards on, though and it handled it fine. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: S. Czarnecki

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack 4 years running!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rack for surfboards, lumber, kayaks, etc... It's held up to four years on top of the car, on multiple long distance trips carrying four boards at once! and now it (well... barely) holds my 27" wide SUP... with NO ADJUSTMENT! By far the best rack for surfboards around!
customer_reviews.author: Chester R Long

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I drove 4000 miles across the country with my 9'0" longboard strapped to these Inno racks. Unbelievably stable and no damage to the board whatsoever. Inno has created the next generation of surf rack for your car.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan M

product_meta.title: INNO Racks - Locking Surfboard Roof Rack - Water Sport Car Top Mount
product_meta.description: The INNO Racks INA744 Locking Surfboard Roof Rack is the best way to lock and transport boards on the roof of your car. The surf carrier features a ratcheting tension system that allows you to securely lock down your board with ease. For protection and security there are rubber cushions and locking covers and keys included, respectively. For vehicles with larger factory crossbars consider the INNO Racks ISF711 Long Bolt Adapter Kit.
feature_bullets: Package Dimensions: 19.05 L x 81.788 H x 29.718 W (centimeters)
